content: this is a summary of a civil case that took place in the klaipėda district court the case involves a matrimonial property dispute between two parties referred to as the applicant and the defendant the applicant has been ordered to pay €100100 for the costs of the proceedings while the defendant is responsible for paying €22100 for stamp duty and €2473 for procedural documents the court has ruled that the defendant will be awarded personal property including a vehicle and that the obligation agreements with third parties will remain the defendants responsibility the case also involves other issues related to the dissolution of the marriage such as child support division of property and debts and compensation for a car acquired during the marriage the court will consider evidence and statements from both parties to make decisions on these matters the applicants claims have been partially successful and they will be responsible for paying some of the defendants costs the court will also determine the amount of stamp duty and procedural costs to be paid by each party
